datafield.subfield: Three black and white photographs related to Ken Russell's documentary The ABC of British Music, which was broadcast by London Weekend Television on February 4, 1988. Two photographs are of the filming process, and are attributed in pencil to Simon Farrell. The third could be a still from the film.
IMDB page for The ABC of British Music
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 3 typewritten scripts for Alice in Russialand, one dated 15.4.93. -- 1 shooting schedule, dated 15.4.93 -- 20 colour slides appearing to show scenes from the film, and attributed to Daniel Meadows.
Items relating to the film Alice in Russialand, written and directed by Ken Russell.
IMDB page for Alice in Russialand
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 12 miniature (approximately 30 X 25 cm) promotional posters for the film. -- 33 black and white photographs, 32 apparently stills from the film, 1 showing Russell on set. -- 34 colour photographic slides, apparently stills from the film.
Items relating to Ken Russell's film Altered States.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 72 black and white photographs, most apparently stills from the film, possibly some from the filming process, one showing Russell copyrighted to MGM 1972. -- a promotional booklet for the film.
Items relating to Ken Russell's 1971 musical comedy The Boyfriend, an adaptation of Sandy Wilson's 1953 musical of the same title.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 101 black and white photographs taken during filming and breaks from filming. Many are attributed to John Jay; some show Russell himself, most are of the actors; one shows Russell's wife, Shirley, with their three sons, and has a note to "Mama Russell" on the back. -- A promotional booklet ("Exhibitor's Campaign Book") for the film (11 pages)
Material relating to Ken Russell's film Billion Dollar Brain, an adaptation of Len Deighton's novel of the same title.
IMDB page for Billion Dollar Brain
Archives Hub record for this item
Photographs showing Russell directing William and Dorothy, one of the episodes of Clouds of Glory.
IMDB page for Clouds of Glory
Archives Hub record for this item
Black and white photographs taken from the making of Russell's film Crimes of Passion. Most photographs appear to show scenes from the film, one shows Russell directing.
IMDB page for Crimes of Passion
Archives Hub record for this item

Black and white photographs relating to Russell's film Dante's Inferno, broadcast by the BBC on 22 December 1967 as part of the documentary series Omnibus. One photograph appears to be a still from the film; the others, some of which are attributed to George Konig, may have been taken during filming.
Archives Hub record for this item
Four copies of scripts for The Death of Alexander Scriabin, a radio play by Ken Russell about the Russian composer and pianist, broadcast in June 1995 on BBC Radio 3.
Archives Hub record for this item
Detailed contents: - A photograph of Victoria Russell, Ken Russell's daughter, 18 months old, with the actor Oliver Reed. -- Apparently a photograph of a scene from the film.
Two photographs taken from the making of Russell's film Debussy.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: 92 sheets (each sheet with multiple photographs) of colour photographs taken from the filming process. -- 5 black and white photographs apparently showing stills from the film, 3 of which appear to be promotional material.
Photographs relating to Russell's film The Devils.
Archives Hub record for this item
Six of the sheets of photographs are held in the third (oversize) drawer in the cabinet.
Three black and white photographs taken during the filming of The Diary of a Nobody, Russell's film based on the novel by George and Weedon Grossmith.
IMDB page for The Diary of a Nobody
Archives Hub record for this item

A treatment by Ken Russell for an episode of The South Bank Show discussing the lives of composer's widows. The treatment is titled Double Exposure, but it was broadcast as Classic Widows by ITV on 5 February 1995.
Archives Hub record for this item

A script (56 pages) for Elgar's Land of Hope, "a screen story by Ken Russell". It is dated 21 January 1976, and is to be distinguished from Russell's 1962 documentary about Elgar. It is unclear whether the script was ever made into a production.
Archives Hub record for this item

24 black and white photographs relating to Ken Russell's film French Dressing, apparently including stills from the film and photographs taken on set, which are labelled "to be returned to Chris Wicking," possibly the photographer.
Archives Hub record for this item
Photographs (6 colour, 3 black and white) taken from Ken Russell's film Gothic.
Archives Hub record for this item
Three scripts of the film Immortal Beloved, written by Ken Russell and Jo Anderson.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 5 copies of a script for the film -- 1 small envelope of negatives -- 27 colour transparencies of photographs taken during filming, showing both Russell and (apparently) scenes from the film, attributed to Mark Bourdillon. -- 159 colour slides taken during filming, showing both Russell and (apparently) scenes from the film, attributed to Stay Still. -- 1 colour photograph, apparently showing Russell and his family.
Material relating to the 1995 short film The Insatiable Mrs. Kirsch, written by Ken Russell and Hetty Baynes.
IMDB page for The Insatiable Mrs. Kirsch
Archives Hub record for this item
Isadora Duncan, the Biggest Dancer in the World
37 black and white photographs taken from Isadora Duncan, the Biggest Dancer in the World, also called Isadora, which was directed by Russell and broadcast by BBC TV in 1966.
IMDB page for Isadora Duncan, the Biggest Dancer in the World
Archives Hub record for this item

Material relating to Russell's film Lady Chatterley, including two black and white photographs of Russell, one with his son Rupert, on set, and two PAL VHS video cassettes (each 120 minutes, made by London Films).
Archives Hub record for this item
Black and white and colour photographs taken from the making of Russell's film Lisztomania. At least one of the photographs is attributed, in pencil, to Simon Farrell.
Archives Hub record for this item

Material relating to Ken Russell's film Mahler. There are 39 black and white photographs that appear to have been taken during film-making, some possibly showing scenes from the film; some are attributed to Frank Connor. There is also a promotional booklet for the film.
Archives Hub record for this item
The booklet is in the third, oversize, drawer in the cabinet.
Twelve black and white photographs apparently taken during the filming of some of Russell's works. It has not been possible to identify the works for these items.
Archives Hub record for this item
2 copies extended treatment for Ming-Ti: The Lowlander, "the first 25 minute episode in the 12 part series by Ken Russell." There is no external evidence to suggest that this was ever produced.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 8 colour photographs, apparently promotional stills. -- 6 black and white photographs taken during filming. -- 3 promotional booklets for the film, one in French, one labelled "Exhibitor's Campaign Book".
Material relating to Russell's film The Music Lovers.
IMDB page for The Music Lovers
Archives Hub record for this item

An album with approximately 100 colour and black and white photographs from Russell's film The Rainbow, including both scenes from the film and photographs of Russell directing and in breaks from the filming. The album has a dedication: "For Ken, "Thank you for the film that changed my life," lots of love, Clive, 89". The album may well be a gift of Clive Coote, to whom some of the photographs are attributed.
Archives Hub record for this item

35 black and white photographs of on-stage and behind-the-scenes action from Rakes Progress, a production of the Stravinsky opera, directed by Russell, at the Maggio Musicale festival in Florence in 1982.
Archives Hub record for this item

An album containing 67 photographs (black and white; colour) relating to Russell's film, Salome's Last Dance, including both scenes from the film and photographs of Russell directing and in breaks from the filming. The album is inscribed as from "Clive", and may well be a gift of Clive Coote, to whom some of the photographs are attributed.
IMDB page for Salome's Last Dance
Archives Hub record for this item
Three copies of a booklet (63 p.), Salome, published by Oper der Stadt Bonn. The publication appears to be designed to accompany a production of Richard Strauss' opera Salome, directed by Russell.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - 133 black and white photographs showing scenes from the film and breaks between filming, including shots of Russell giving direction and of Victoria Russell (age 10), daughter of Ken Russell, who had a role in the film. -- Promotional material for the film: 1 colour photograph, 1 MGM Pressbook, 2 small posters, 1 sheet titled 'Press & Advertising Material for MGM's Savage Messiah.'
Material relating to Ken Russell's film, Savage Messiah, which tells the story of the French sculptor Henri Gaudier-Brzeska.
Archives Hub record for this item
The Strange Affliction of Anton Bruckner

Photographs relating to Ken Russell's film The Strange Affliction of Anton Bruckner. All photographs show Russell directing the film. There are two large (approximately 40 x 30 cm) black and white photographs and 4 small (approximately 15 x 10 cm) colour photographs.
IMDB page for The Strange Affliction of Anton Bruckner
Archives Hub record for this item

Material relating to Ken Russell's film Tommy. There are 10 black and white photographs showing scenes from the film or during breaks in filming, including some of Russell. There is also a colour program to accompany the film.
Archives Hub record for this item

Detailed contents: - A typed 'first draft script', 1 June 1995. -- What appears to be a draft for a promotional booklet for the film, including a synopsis, short biographies of key cast and crew. -- A notebook containing a handwritten version of the script.
Material relating to Ken Russell's film Treasure Island, which was broadcast by Channel 4 in 1995.
Archives Hub record for this item
Two Women and a Horse, or, St Mawr
A typewritten script for a screenplay entitled Two Women and a Horse by Ken Russell. It is based on D. H. Lawrence's novella St Mawr.
Archives Hub record for this item

Photographs relating to Ken Russell's film Valentino. There are eight colour photographs that appear to be promotional material, and two black and white photographs of the filming, one showing Russell.
Archives Hub record for this item

- 21 black and white photographs taken during filming, some apparently showing scenes from the film, others showing the filming process. -- Promotional material for the film: 4 colour promotional photographs, 1 promotional booklet ("Exhibitor's Campaign Book"), 1 sheet showing various different advertisements.
Material relating to Ken Russell's film, Women in Love.
IMDB page for Women in Love
Archives Hub record for this item

Still photographs taken by Russell during his time as a professional photographer. There are cuttings from magazines ( Illustrated and The Sketch ) containing his photographs, and one black and white photograph.
Archives Hub record for this item
The items are filed under: Ken Russell: friends and family.

Detailed contents: - Five black and white promotional photographs of Dorothy Lamour, taken from her works. -- One black and white photograph of Ken Russell with director Jack Gold, apparently on stage at a conference. -- Two black and white photographs, apparently of a shop window display about Ken Russell.
Various photographs owned by Russell that do not relate to a particular one of his works.
Archives Hub record for this item
The items are filed under: Ken Russell: friends and family.
A letter written to Mr Russell from Joanne Deacon (dated 21.03.94); it appears to have originally accompanied a work for Russell to read.
Archives Hub record for this item
Items filed under: Ken Russell: Friends and Family
Magazines, brochures, and pamphlets relating to the film industry, including: Critics Choice, programmes from the National Film Theatre, the New Cinema Club, the London Film Festival.
Archives Hub record for this item
Held in a box in drawer 4.
Three empty film tins, one reel of film, one light, one clapperboard.
Archives Hub record for this item
Held in a box in drawer 4.

A newspaper poster for The Sun (Melbourne), approximately 70 x 50 cm, displaying the headline "Spoleto Nudity Shock" and dated Friday, September 12, 1986. It must related to the Spoleto Festival, held in Melbourne for the first time in 1986, at which Russell was an exhibitor.
Archives Hub record for this item
Items filed under: Ken Russell: Friends and Family
